title.narrative: Second Rural Water Supply & Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The primary objectives of the project are to: (i) improve rural water supply and sanitation sector institutional performance and mainstream the "Fund Board" (Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Fund Development Board) approach in the Government's system, and (ii) support communities to form inclusive local water supply and sanitation user groups that can plan, implement, and operate drinking water and sanitation infrastructure that delivers sustainable health, hygiene and productivity benefits to rural households.

condition.narrative: Board shall implement the IPDP, in accordance with the objectives, policies, procedures, time schedules and other provisions setforth to benefit indigenous people
DfID Grant Agreement shall have failed to become effective by July 31, 2005 or such later date
The Borrower shall allocate, from its own resources, adequate operating budget to the RWSS Monitoring and Evaluation Unit withinMPPW to carry out RWSS sector monitoring
The Borrower shall have failed to establish in operational manner the RWSS Sector M&E system by July 16, 2005, or such later dateas agreed with IDA
The Borrower shall maintain, in form and substance satisfactory to IDA, IPDP, and implement it in accordance with the objectives,policies, procedures, time schedules and other provisions

title.narrative: Number of other water service providers that the project is supporting

comment.narrative: No WSUC that is responsible for providing water supply to the WSUGs in the project areas
Total no. of WSUCs expected to be formed under the Project (Schemes that have completed Development Phase will have a WSUC)
1961 WSUGs formed till date under the Project.

title.narrative: Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: No people in project area with access to improved water sources within 15 minutes round trip.
Original project plus additional financing target
Additional 58 implementation phase schemes of Batch VI, VII and VIII covering about 35,000 population will be completed by EOP.

title.narrative: New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention

comment.narrative: Household connection is not a target. The service standard is 15 mins. round trip. If there is a demand and households are willingto pay the additional costs, the Project provides households connection. There is no specific end of Project Target for thisindicator.

Household tap connections were provided where feasible and where there was demand. In such cases, the house owner paid theadditional cost for the service which is higher than the 15 minute round trip standpost service which the Project finances.

title.narrative: Percentage population in project area with access to hygiene and sanitation facilities

baseline.value: Batch IV - 12% Batch V - 22.2% Batch VI- 18.8% Batch VII- 7.6%

target.value: 50% of the households served with sanitary household latrines

comment.narrative: Percentage reported above is cumulative based on completed schemes of the different batches at the time of reporting as againstthe national average of 38%.

title.narrative: Percentage decrease in the prevalence of diarrheal disease morbidity among young children

baseline.value: Batch V schemes 24.6% cases, Batch VI schemes 23.4% cases and Batch VII schemes 28.8%

comment.narrative: Based on CDA Impact Study of Batch VII

target.value: Board established as a regular and autonomous sector institution through an an Act of Parliament

actual.value: To the extent allowed under the Formation Order, the Board is exercising its autonomy

comment.narrative: The Bill to make the Board a regular sector institution has been under discussion with the Parliamentary Legislative Committee fora final discussion before approval by Parliament

baseline.value: MPPW RWSS sector M&E unit established

target.value: RWSS sector M&E system fully operational and functioning.

actual.value: RWSS sector M&E system developed and being made operational.

comment.narrative: Population and validation of information in the system with the first set of inputs received from 33 districts. Training ofDWSSCCs on the system ongoing

title.narrative: Number of schemes in operation and functioning satisfactorily with community O&M

comment.narrative: Additional 58 schemes will be completed by eop

title.narrative: Number of WSUCs with greater than the stipulated number of women members

baseline.value: No such WSUCs in scheme areas

target.value: At least 3 women members in the WSUC.

comment.narrative: Minimum requirement of 3 women members achieved in all 1557 schemes contracted thus far- this target surpassed in 585 schemes

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: approximate no. of community tapstands to be constructed to serve population of 1.04 million in 1436 communities
On average about 17 tapstands (community water points) in 1422 schemes
